choices.D: Perform user acceptance tests for all security user stories.
choices.B: Perform accessibility testing in the same model-driven apps the users will be using.
choices.A: Perform bounds testing by using a user account assigned to the custom security role directly.
choices.C: Perform penetration testing on the Azure AD tenant.

discussion.content:
Correct Answer
C. Penetration testing, also called pen testing or ethical hacking, is the practice of testing a computer system, network or web application to find security vulnerabilities that an attacker could exploit. Penetration testing can be automated with software applications or performed manually.

comments.content: tests are not for see if they work, but if it is secure, so is b and c

questions.question_text:
A client is preparing to go live with a Dynamics 365 Sales implementation that uses Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) group to manage security.
The chief compliance officer (CCO) requires that all solutions meet the following requirements:
✑ Undergo security testing to verify they are secure.
✑ Address the needs of users with disabilities.
You need to recommend additional tests to be performed.
Which tests should you recommend? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

A company asks you to migrate more than 5,000 records from Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (on-premises) to the online version of Dynamics 365 Sales.
You used a third-party utility to migrate the data. The city and state are displayed in the field that should show the street address.
You must get the data migrated properly in the next 24 hours but have no one to help with this task. You have no other add-ins and do not want any more customization.
You need to resolve the issues to migrate the data.
What should you do?

comments.content: Yes, I dont understand the "remove data", from A.

Assumption here is that street address field is not correct so you need to add the street back + You need to place the state in state field and city in the city field.... So by only exporting street adress field (no s here) you won't be able to perform that

discussion.content: Answer should be C only, as City and State are representing Street Address then just export excel and create a column as Street Address and use concatenate formula CONCATINATE(City," ",State) and finally import it in production. That simple!
Question describes data load already happened with error. need to fix in 24 hrs. so Answer is A.

A is correct. In the question it is assumed that you already did the migration, then notice the mistake in the street address field. So you need to remove the data, correct the mapping, and migrate again.

choices.C: Export the street address field, make changes, and then import the changes.
choices.D: Manually edit the street address, state, and city field, and then enter appropriate data.
choices.A: Remove data, ensure that field mappings of city and state are correct, and then migrate the data.
choices.B: Create a custom connector in the Common Data Service, and then migrate the data.

discussion.content: This is UAT performance in D365 UI. An Azure SLQ will help with reporting but will not improve D365 performance. Option two moving part of business logic out of Dynamics to Azure Functions will help performance.

comments.content: I guess C is because it comes from on-prem, assuming there might be SQL direct queries which were not impacting perf onprem, but same function is impacting perf online as you don't query sql directly anymore.

Tryly is correct. Solution architected is for online not on prem. UAT team will be testing online implementation and is experiencing performance issues. None of the options but moving logic to Azure Functions will improve performance.

discussion.content: C because of the nature of access a baseline improvement of perf will be there for every op. And please don't say we should have used Azure Functions when you are on UAT - You might lose your job !
I guess C is correct. "business logic out of Dynamics to Azure Functions will help performance", is true, but C is true too and less tricky.

questions.question_text:
You design a solution for a client that is moving from Microsoft Dynamics CRM on-premises to Dynamics 365 Sales.
During user acceptance testing, testers report significant performance issues.
You need to recommend a solution to mitigate the performance issues.
What should you recommend?

choices.D: Implement workflows. Schedule workflows to run at daily intervals.
choices.C: Enable direct access to a Microsoft Azure-replicated SQL database.
choices.B: Create a Microsoft Azure Service Bus endpoint in Dynamics 365 Sales. Implement business logic in Azure functions.
choices.A: Increase the plug-in execution time limit of the organization to five minutes.

comments.content: Answer is correct, you can check directly when importing managed solution

discussion.content:
The answer given is correct. 
Upgrade, Stage for Upgrade , Update 
https://crmkeeper.com/2019/10/09/managed-solutions-update-vs-upgrade-vs-stage/
First is Update and last is Upgrade, because you want to replace previous versions

I think, it should be: 

Update - because you don't need a upgrade to roll up patches. 
Stage for Upgrade
Upgrade - because you need a upgrade to replace previous versions.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A client plans to upgrade several solutions in the Dynamics 365 Customer Service application.
You need to recommend which upgrade option will achieve the outcome.
Which method should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate options to the correct outcomes. Each option may be used once, more than once, or not at all.
You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

comments.content:
"You need to recommend a solution to enable the calculation in real time."

Because it's asked a realtime calculation, the answer has to be BC.

discussion.content: If the second answer should be D, always asynchronous remain! Then B and C

D is incorrect here. The main point of the question is REAL TIME; therefore, you can only focus on solutions that can deliver real time responses.
That only leaves by default B and C and both are valid solutions.
Why not "B. Convert the asynchronous workflows to a synchronous plug-in." ?

questions.question_text:
A company is implementing Dynamics 365 Sales.
The company has turned off out-of-the-box quote calculations in order to implement its own custom calculations.
When users update a line item on a quote, they expect to see an updates total for the quote in real time. Users are reporting inconsistent behavior, with some aggregations taking up to two hours.
You review the system design and notice many asynchronous workflows.
You need to recommend a solution to enable the calculation in real time.
Which two options should you recommend? Each answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.A: Implement a business process flow to replace the existing workflows.
choices.D: Consolidate multiple asynchronous workflows into a single asynchronous workflow.
choices.B: Convert the asynchronous workflows to a synchronous plug-in.
choices.C: Consolidate asynchronous workflows into a single real-time workflow.
